Title: Geographical variation in the response of visceral leishmaniasis to paromomycin in East Africa: a multicentre, open-label, randomized trial
Location(s): 5 centres: Ethiopia (Gondar University Hospital, Arba Minch Hospital); Sudan (MSF Treatment Centre, Um el Khjer; Ministry of Health Hospital, Kassab); Kenya (CCR, KEMRI, Nairobi)
Study arm(s): (1) SSG, 20mg/kg, IV or IM, OD, 21D; (2) PM, 15mg/kg, IM, OD, 21D; (3) Combination of PM and SSG, same dose, frequency and route, 17D

Title: Safety and efficacy of single dose versus multiple doses of AmBisome for treatment of visceral leishmaniasis in eastern Africa: a randomised trial
Location(s): 3 centres: Ethiopia (Gondar University Hospital, Arba Minch Hospital); Sudan (Ministry of Health Hospital, Kassab)
Study design: Multicentre, open-label, non-inferiority, randomised trial with adaptive design
Study arm(s): LAMB, IV, either single dose at (1) 7.5mg/kg; (2) 10mg/kg; (3) 12.5mg/kg; (4) 15mg/kg, or multiple dose at (5) 3mg/kg, OD, D1-5, 14, 21 (total 21mg/kg)

Title: Pharmacokinetics, Safety, and Efficacy of an Allometric Miltefosine Regimen for the Treatment of Visceral Leishmaniasis in Eastern African Children: An Open-label, Phase II Clinical Trial
Location(s): 2 clinical sites: Kachelibra, West Pokot County, Kenya; Amudat, Karamoja sub-region, Uganda
Study arm(s): (1) MF, allometric dosing per sex, height, and weight, BD, PO, 28D\tnote{1}

Title: Paromomycin for the treatment of visceral leishmaniasis in Sudan: a randomized, open-label, dose-finding study
Location(s): Ministry of Health Hospital, Kassab, Sudan
Study design: Open-label, open-label, phase II, randomised, dose-finding study
Study arm(s): (1) PM, 15mg/kg, IM, OD, 28D; (2) PM, 20mg/kg, IM, OD, 21D

Title: Sodium stibogluconate (SSG) & paromomycin combination compared to SSG for visceral leishmaniasis in East Africa: a randomised controlled trial
Location(s): 6 centres: 5 centres described in Khalil 2014 (above) and Amudat Hospital, Uganda.
Study arm(s): (1) SSG, 20mg/kg, IV or IM, OD, 30D; (2) PM, 20mg/kg, IM, OD, 21D; (3) combination of SSG, 20mg/kg, IV or IM, OD, 17D and PM, 15mg/kg, IM, OD, 17D

Title: Ethiopian visceral leishmaniasis: generic and proprietary sodium stibogluconate are equivalent; HIV co-infected patients have a poor outcome
Journal: Trans R Soc Trop Med Hyg
Location(s): Temporary MSF treatment centre, Densha, Ethiopia
Study design: Open-label controlled trial with alterate allocation

Title: A comparison of miltefosine and sodium stibogluconate for treatment of visceral leishmaniasis in an Ethiopian population with high prevalence of HIV infection
Location(s): 2 centres in Ethiopia: Humera Hospital, Mycadra Health Center
Study arm(s): (1) SSG, 20mg/kg/day, IM, OD, 30D (extended if HIV positive); (2) MF, 100mg/day, PO, OD, 28D

Title: A randomized comparison of branded sodium stibogluconate and generic sodium stibogluconate for the treatment of visceral leishmaniasis under field conditions in Sudan
Location(s): 2 MSF treatment centres in Gedaref State, Sudan: Um Kuraa, Kassab

Title: Efficacy and Safety of AmBisome in Combination with Sodium Stibogluconate or Miltefosine and Miltefosine Monotherapy for African Visceral Leishmaniasis: Phase II Randomized Trial.
Location(s): 3 centres: Kenya (Kimalel Health Centre); Sudan (Dooka Hospital and Ministry of Health Hospital, Kassab)
Study design: Phase II, open-label, non-comparative randomised trial (adaptive-sequential design)
Study arm(s): (1) Combination of LAMB, 10mg/kg, IV, single dose, D1 and SSG, 20mg/kg, IM, OD, D2-11; (2) Combination of LAMB, 10mg/kg, IV, single dose, D1, and MF, 2.5mg/kg, PO, OD, D2-11; (3) MF, 2.5mg/kg, PO, OD, 28D
